lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episodes of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have returning this week our fantastic guests, Ashly Burch and Sumalee Montano. They've been amazing, we're excited to have them back, and going to see what this next adventure of the story's going to have. Before we get to that, we have some announcements to get through, beginning with our fantastic sponsor and friends at D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: D&D Beyond, everybody, two new products have been announced on D&D Beyond. The Guildmaster's Guide to Ravnica, alternate title is That's So Ravnica, available for preorder now on the D&D Beyond marketplace, officially will be released on November 9th. Also, The Wayfarer's Guide to Eberron, alternate title, The Werfernder's Gerd to Erberron, available for purchase now on the D&D Beyond marketplace. As a reminder, anyone who already has purchased the Legendary bundle can pre-order or purchase these and any future content at a 15% discount, everyone. Which has the savings baked right in. I've been using D&D Beyond for a while now, and they just redid their layout, took me a while to get used to it. For those of you at home using D&D Beyond, I have a couple of tips, pointers, for the new layout, to remind myself where things are layed out. It's like little mnemonics. It's a weird thing. On the right side of the screen, you can remember "L E F," so right sort of like, LEF, left, sort of. That's where loot, equipment and features are. On the left, is "I A A," insight and awareness. I'll put that down here. Then in the middle, is "A T R," which is things you can add to roll. ATR.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a mounting sense of dread.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right up top is "M S T," which is makes saving throws. That's what you add to make saving throws. That's Sam's little guide to how you can remember the layout of D&D Beyond. And that's it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's going to be crazy. It's going to be absolutely nuts. Other than that as well, we have up on our YouTube channel now the VOD of our Vox Machina character buildout for Pillars of Eternity

lines.name: II
lines.text: Deadfire. I went ahead and messed around on stream for about an hour or so earlier this week to show you guys my interpretation of building our first campaign characters, Vox Machina, in Pillars

lines.name: EII
lines.text: Deadfire, and if you want to check it out, it's on the YouTube. That's youtube.com/criticalrole, and you get to watch me make each character, and we hang out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I watched part of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was pretty good, and I might watch it again so I can actually build those characters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think you should, that surprised me. I've never really done a live stream of just myself playing a video game before, so that was very new experience for me. Thank you for your patience. Go check it out if you want to. Be sure to check out the Beast of Winter DLC for Deadfire is coming out soon. You can pick up the game at versesevil.com/criticalrole, and it's a fun one, so check it out if you haven't yet. Reminder that we do our Wyrmwood giveaways during the breaks, and they're going to be happening over here at the Critical Role Twitch chat, so I'll prompt you when we come to our mid break today, but we need you to come over to the Critical Role chat to enter the giveaway, and then head on back to Geek & Sundry, or wherever else you're watching. That'll be at twitch.tv/criticalrole. Talks Machina, our after show discussion about what happens this week will be happening next Tuesday at 7:00pm Pacific, here on the Geek & Sundry Twitch and Alpha, where our fantastic host Brian W. Foster interviews us, and makes us feel a little better about ourselves after the chaos the previous week had.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought you were going to say makes us feel a little uncomfortable.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That was the subtext I was going to go into, but I'll leave that for you, Sam. I believe that's all I have--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's no merch, there's nothing merchy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We made announcements online.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's brand-new merch, GenCon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm trying to honor the memory of Laura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're trying to get better at spercing our announcements out through other things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So we're not barraging the audience.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So me talking right now is just wasting time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, essentially, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Cool, cool cool.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you are curious about any merch stuff, we do have some new merch coming up at GenCon. You can go check it out at critrole.com for all the details.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We've got some other fun surprises for folks that are coming, too. Anyway, much love, I think it's time--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, so tense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome back, everyone. Last we left off, The Mighty Nein, who had acquired two new allies in Keg, the dwarven fighter, and Nila, the firbolg druid, had made their way to the city of Shadycreek Run. After making your way through the town, spending an evening staying at the Landlocked Lady, and getting some information about where to find info about your quarry, and where your friends may have been taken to after they were captured by the Iron Shepherds, a traveling slavers crew.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You sought out and cased the exterior of the Sour Nest, which is the fortress that was given to the Iron Shepherds by the family that pays them and keeps them in their employ. You decided to send your new druid friend, Nila, in the form of a small mouse, over the wall, delivery via owl. She snuck through some portions of the fortress to gather intel, and to get an idea of where you were going and what may reside within. A few close calls, and some discovery of what can be expected within the interior, you made your way back, safely, to join your friends.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I forgot about the baby. (sigh)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, the meal that Lorenzo was having.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry. That just occurred to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Upon accidentally spooking one of the outer guards who were walking the perimeter of the wall that surrounds the Sour Nest, you immediately picked up what you had, fled south, back through the Savalierwood, on your way to Shadycreek Run to look for means of possibly finding more help for this endeavor when nightfall hits, and whatever else you can do to prepare for the necessary evacuation of your allies. And that's where we left off. Mighty Nein, as you've charged back through the purplish-gray corrupted Savalierwood, the midday sun barely visible through slight peaking cracks through the canopy above you, leaping and hearing these large growling sounds and hoots, you beeline it as best you can, and as quickly as you can, before you breach into the outskirts of the northern side of the North Clover area. You're now between some of the nearby buildings, and you immediately begin to see some of the relatively shady denizens of this north side of Shadycreek Run that glance over their shoulder, their hooded selves watching you as you pass. You slow your gait, as you are no longer fleeing, per se, but you have made your way back to the town. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point it would be midday, a little bit in the afternoon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. Oh god! It's midday! What do we do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're trying to gather allies right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's the plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and we don't have all the time in the world because we are trying to intervene before the worst happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We mentioned about going and looking to see if a Tasker would be up to it. There were the Taskers, and there were the other group of hired workers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, The Grunge Gang-- The Grudge Gang, which the Taskers are a part of it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, is is Grudge or Grunge?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grudge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I just say Grunge is better name?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it like, the Grudge Gang is an umbrella corporation of the Taskers, or vice versa?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vice versa. The Grudge Gang is the overarching, loose network of mercenaries that sell swords and do not affiliate directly with any of the other political powers. They're all just outside of the system within the town. The Taskers are a small subsect of the Grudge Gang that have taken it upon themselves to keep the peace to a certain extent.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we get a sense of the Taskers, are they just a group, like us? Like a small group, or we don't know yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you don't know. You've had some experience here. The Taskers, best that you can surmise, you haven't had a lot of dealings with them, they are probably in the neighborhood of 30 to 35 people. They are not a massive group by any means, and they're stretched a little thin, but because a lot of them have friends within the Grudge Gang, and people they've worked with before, they can usually call upon friends if need be, especially if they have some coin to their side and they have a specific endeavor they need to do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you think we should go talk one, chat one up?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It seems like the best option to me. I'm not sure who else we could turn to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, just to play devil's advocate here, is it an issue if we get a hired mercenary group to kill another underground faction in their same town? Is that--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could it trace back to Ophelia, is that what you are saying?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I don't know, it's a weird political issue, hiring someone in the system.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe before we go randomly hiring people: what do we need to make this attack? We can probably get in. Also, we're not attacking, right? We're just going to go and try to rescue, or maybe pick off one or two of them, or smoke them out, so that the prisoners, or whatever, have to leave and we can rescue, right? We're not trying to kill everyone in the motherfucking house, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well this Ophelia wants us to kill everyone in the motherfucking house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well I just want to get our people out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then we are not fulfilling our responsibilities.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It will be impossible to save our friends without killing them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think she's right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We go at night, and the first step is taking care of the two, there could be more, but two that we saw on the wall, whoever is on the wall at night, silently. Then, from all you've told us, we have-- this might be incomplete information-- but three. There is the shithead himself, and then two you saw.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: At least two eating.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So three total that we know about.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: But there were many more beds.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, who knows who could arrive in the time that we're gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is also correct.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we need to be prepared for all of them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But are we going to hire muscle, or magic, or what are we trying to get? What helps us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I miss Jester's healing spells.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe there's a place to buy some potions.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well it seems like-- I mean, I'm not the stealthiest person. It seems like having more numbers is a good thing. I don't know if we could create a distraction of some kind, lead some of them away. I don't know.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can do that. I'm good at that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Diversions?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You're very excited about this, Nila.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I want to get in there as fast as we can.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, look. The solution might end up solving itself, who know who in this town is even willing to go up against the Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, would I know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: LIAM, ASHLEY, MARISHA, MATT
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The place where they keep the prisoners is underground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could we just burn down the building? Burn down the motherfucking house?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's mostly stone.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Burn down the-- is there wood in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's elements of wood from a decoration standpoint, but for the most part, it's a stone structure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could bring in a lot of kindling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Smoke them out! That's actually not a bad idea, now that I think about it, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you were in this house, as a mouse, there was no way down there. It was a solid trap door. You don't know what was under it?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I could hear them, but that's the only thing that I could see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What did you hear, specifically?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I heard voices, I remember that. I was trying to listen for my partner and my son. I know they were the voices of the captured people, the prisoners. I believe I heard voices as well of some of the murderers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we need to peel this like an onion. We need to, I believe, get some help. Get some reassurance. Outer layer of the onion is making sure we take whoever is on the walls, whoever is keeping watch, out, silently, so that we can begin anew with the building itself. I think that either you or my friend here should go in ahead of us so we have some idea of what is happening. Once in a while I turn this one into a spider. It is slow, but it is very undetectable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you feel differently?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, I'm just imagining an infiltration with the spider, like that's feasible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tip of the spear!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go, Frumpkin, go!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Get him! Now bite him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lorenzo, felled by a brown recluse!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Put him in his boot!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Truthfully, there are ways that I can hurt people with a spider, but I'm just talking about having a look around so that we are not walking into something different than what you saw last night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure. Literally anything is better than a spider, though. For that. I just want to point that out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I disagree with you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean they've got a lot of eyes, I get that, but I think in terms of a movement situation, spiders aren't the best.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Agree to disagree.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you guys need a second, should we take a smoke break?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are new. This is very typical. It's just part of the group dynamic. We are all friends.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like, have you ever seen a debate team? They pick one side, and the other, and then they just go at it for a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's no really debating in Shadycreek Run. Mostly insult, kill, insult, kill.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They should really start a debate club.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We should really start the first one!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am a master debater.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shadycreek Debaters? Side mission.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shady Debaters!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shady Debaters? That's all I care about now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well that's our next merch piece there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Laura, make a Shady Debaters debate team shirt!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we want to take numbers down, so we peel the outer layer separately. If all goes well, then there is whoever is upstairs. The big X factor is what is what is beneath. We don't know how many people are underneath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we went in the dead of night, and I know you have a spell that can lock a door, or shut a door or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I can find materials in Shadycreek. I need gold dust, a lot of gold dust. How likely is that here?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would I know where to find that? Would that be the general store, would that have that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They may have it there, yeah. You haven't had to acquire gold dust before, but if you were to ask around, you could see if there's some place in the vicinity that might carry it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To first get gold dust, I would need gold.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Which we would also need to hire people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have some.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much do we have? I have next to nothing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have 130.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have ten gold pieces.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you say ten?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh wow.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am happy to contribute that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it 130 gold? Or is it silver that I have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 130 gold.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What about in the haversack? Does Jester have any funds in there?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. That's a good question. I'll reach in and see what she has.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got a little bit of funds.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Text thread explodes in five, four, three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need my thing? Where's the currency in here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you go under equipment--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't remember your handy acronym?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I need it written down! Oh there it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Remember, "LIAM EATS FARTS."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "LIAM EATS FARTS!" That's right, it's right here. I have a few hundred gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe we need people on the outside to take care of folks on watch. The onion you're talking about, maybe the outer layers are the hired hands, and then we're the ones who go in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it could be a group effort. I feel very confident for many of our skills for the ones on the outside. What I'm concerned about is entering the front door. What is behind? What I would like to do is go when they are sleeping and hopefully murder them in their sleep, is the best case.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Why don't we call them out, then? Why don't we make them come outside? We have more abilities outside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But then they'll have weapons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the thing when someone is sleeping in a bed is they are like little-- (whispering) I was going to say babies. I shouldn't say that!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't say that to her, especially.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I cannot use my lightning inside. That is all I'm saying.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if we lure one of them out for you to fry like a chicken?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would be okay with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a little bit that we have to play this by ear. I think we should go at night to handle things when it is the least busy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there anything we're missing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have no way of healing ourselves if we die, unless you have healing potions on you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, maybe we can find some in Shadycreek.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have two potions of greater healing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many do we all have? She has two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Of what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Healing potions.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have Healing Words.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY, MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Does that help?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That does help!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Excellent! And I have those Goodberries!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Those are good! Those are great!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: And I can help give us extra power. In my clan, we have a bear spirit known as Oaktar. If I invoke the spirit of Oaktar, it gives us each extra power.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Your clan sounds awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I have to go to church or anything?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, you just have to be-- I think it's within 30 feet of where I put the spirit totem.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That seems strangely specific.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm into it, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So to Nott's point, what do we need? We need fighters, we need magic? What do we need?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like the idea of getting some sort of fighter, especially if Nila can maybe take out that outer onion layer with the lightning. We should have found a better analogy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Than an onion? Well, how about we're just going to kill the people on the wall, how is that for a metaphor?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like the idea of someone with a little bit of muscle and then another person who is adept at healing injuries.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we did hear about that weird-- someone said that there's some priest or something, or cleric?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the woods.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ophelia mentioned that, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, so we could go see if they could give us--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aid.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or come along?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did Ophelia mention how far out into the woods that person was?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travel on foot is about roughly four to six hours depending on how well you can make your way through the terrain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is the same day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's like two in the afternoon, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we can make it tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I oddly trust that more than hiring someone from The Grudge Gang.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, that is a good point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like The Grudge Gang might have ties to the Iron Shepherds or at least an inside man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, friendsies.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I mean we could try, but if all they are is a healer--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would be amazing, though. I mean healing potions are nice, but we need someone who can-- we get killed a lot or nearly, you know?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've seen some pretty badass priests in my day.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have any sense of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She mentioned some of the kooky ones out in the woods, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she mentioned a Blooming Grove.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I have any sense of what that is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've not necessarily heard of The Blooming Grove. Roll a history check, actually.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This not going to go well. 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's not too bad. You've vaguely heard of The Blooming Grove, but it's not referred to that very often. It's more referred to do as The Bone Orchard.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hmm, less fun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you haven't been there, but from what you know, it's this strange, ancient gravesite that's been on the outskirts of town, a few miles out, since before the town was built.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are these healers considered by people in Shadycreek Run to be wackadoos? Or are they--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some folk in here tend to put on the air of not being superstitious, but the Savalierwood carries a lot of superstition with it. Some folks, while they may play it off, still seem to get a little nervous about delving too deep into it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's a lot of crazy shit in the woods, so they must be able to hold their own, or at least remain discrete.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They don't belong to any pact, or group that we would need to negotiate with?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No, they live outside the-- I mean, they're not even really related to the clans.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did we hear what god they worship?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I feel like if it was one of the accepted gods of The Empire, you wouldn't have to hide out in the woods. I'm kind of into this idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We can try.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it worth asking a Tasker first? What would we even ask? Just how much it would be to hire you for some muscle?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. They're not affiliated directly. It's better for them to not be affiliated with any particular groups, so-- but you know. This is not a great place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we're weighing two things against each other. One is expediency because there are many people in Shadycreek who could possibly lend a sword or ability. But I think that you are correct. That there is no telling their allegiance, and I'm not ruling them out, but this person out in the woods: probably not in the pocket of our enemies. We need to come to a decision promptly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, how hardy would you say the mental state of your companions is?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The ones in captivity?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I thought you meant us, because we're right here. We can hear you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No. I know that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Probably pretty unstable.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What, do you think that they would be susceptible to torture?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Being controlled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's probably flipped.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, then there's no rush.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or wrapped them around her finger, one way or the other. No, they are actually pretty-- they've got their shit together.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They arguably have their shit together way more than the three of us do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would they look after--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A child?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, especially Jester.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then maybe it's all right to take a little bit more time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have to make a decision.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing past two to three in the afternoon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You said it's four hours there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four to six hours depending on how well you travel.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We have our horses?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are we walking or horsing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's walking. Your horse isn't going to go any faster than you in the middle of this very clustered forest. There's no path that leads to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Brisk power walk there, that'll get us there right around sunset. Talk to people. Power walk back, should get us there back--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For the Tonight Show?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Lorenzo loves that show. He'll be up watching it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We'll change the plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We might be able to go and get back in time, is what I'm saying, and still be able to attack tonight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the household, ja. If we find what we find in the woods is helpful enough, and we feel good with what we got. Then in the middle of the night is a go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If it is a total bust, then that sucks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can still find a Tasker.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, they don't have a bedtime.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We want to hit it at two or three in the morning.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's go. Are you good with that, Nila? You seem apprehensive.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I could check my smell bag, but I trust you right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, check your smell bag.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh thank you. It makes me feel so much better.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See if it passes the smell test.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever makes you feel comfortable.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: This is for going to find the priest who has special abilities for reviving the dead and healing people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (fart noise)

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Pretty good. Okay, this is for The Taskers and The Grunge Gang.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She took your name for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's a better name.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Did I mistake it?

lines.name: ASHLEY, SAM
lines.text: No, no.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's perfect. Smell your bag.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It smells salty. Salty versus a little bit of a raw, but grounded spicy flavor. I like that one. Let us go see the priest. Thank you, smell bag.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You cannot argue with that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. You cannot argue with someone who talks to a smell bag.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That is accurate.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It has given me so much comfort over many years. I love it. Thank you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, shall we?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY, MARISHA
lines.text: Let's power walk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Butt-cheeks clenched.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's the one where you wiggle? Is that power walking?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Speed walking.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know like grandmas in malls, like around Christmas time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are we Prancercising?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone has their Fitbits attuned?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First off, what's your marching order, please?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, also are our horses dead?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we can take the horses. It wouldn't speed us up, but at least we'd be on horses.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can take them with you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But it wouldn't speed us up, because it's the woods?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because it's like a thick wood.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's walk.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Who's up front? Who's in the back? Who's guiding what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would I know better, potentially, where I'm going? Should I be in front? Or have I never been to this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So who wants to be making--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nila, you seem to know about the woods. No?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would be happy to. Oh yes, survival is good for me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will walk just behind Nila.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Nila's helming that.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You are relying on me. I'm very happy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's just the biggest. I'm going to stand next to the biggest person.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a good call.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's still reliance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's behind or near Caleb?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll take up the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau in the middle?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nott, do you want the middle?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. I'll put Frumpkin there, next to-- okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuh-wumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you to make a survival check, please.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: She is superstitiously leading us around, just smelling.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it girl.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was almost great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there anything to add to-- ooh.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten, okay. You still have your Luck feat if you want to, unless you want to save it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have two more points left.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think we should use it. Yes. I would like to use one Luck point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One more Luck point.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: 17 plus seven. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24, okay!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: We shall survive.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not only do you swiftly manage to find the portions of the wooded paths that are least blockaded by thorny brambles and fallen half-rotted trees, but you also manage to help the party avoid a few small openings that look uniquely and uncomfortably welcoming. In the midst of a wood like this, you know from your experience as well, that it is not always a good idea to step where it seems most inviting, when you know the wood around you to be less so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Yes, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushing on at a fairly intense speed, within three and a half hours, not even the full four--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to make your way to an area where the color notably changes ahead of you. The somewhat still purple-gray color that suffuses most of the natural landscape within the Savalierwood, gives way to a patch of green in the distance. This is the first sign that calls forth that warm sensation you got when you had checked this path within your smell bag. As the rest of you begin to gather up behind Nila, the closer you get you begin to watch as these winter trees, that comprise most of this northern forest, give way to green oaks and swamp-based plant life. The temperature, as you get to a certain threshold, begins to be not quite as biting cold, slightly warmer with each step. Looking around immediately, the first thing that catches your eye is this large wall of tangled vine and thorns. The same purplish-gray color. The green is still ahead of you. Do you guys want to continue on? Anything you want to do?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You said there's a wall of thorns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks like a natural wall that curls up about five or so feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: In our way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In your way, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far to the sides does it go? As far as the eye can see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 11 plus nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe about 100 feet or so to the northern side of it. You've been traveling northwest to reach this part of the forest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't see over the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see over it a bit, as there's only about five or so feet most places. As you get a little bit closer, you can see areas where these tangle of vines are pulled apart or have entirely enclosed, and you see long-rusted, wrought iron bars, a fence of some kind. A boundary that was placed long ago, that has since been slowly taken back by nature. You then begin to see that area of the wall that you had noticed, Nott, that had seemed to be bending, and the vines have actually curled over and bent it downward. It seems that whatever this little section of the forest is-- whatever protective magics that once contained this outer vicinity have begun to give in to the corruption of the Savalierwood.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we hop the fence?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One moment. I send Frumpkin up to flit about 50 feet ahead to see if there is anything ahead, or from a bird's eye view that we are unable to detect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a perception check for Frumpkin with advantage because it is still in the owl form.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Within this third area, you can see not just a lack of snow, or ice, or the winter chill, but a nearly humid summer warmth, something more akin to the southern tip of the Empire or even Menagerie Coast. It is an unexpected and extreme shift in temperature and weather. There is something unnatural, or at least magical, that maintains this little pocket of untouched paradise. There you can see small pools, bits of bog where the soft green and browns of compost fall into green, thick, algae-covered bits of water. You can see dozens and dozens of stone tablets, about a foot to two feet high, with bits of script across them, too far to see, that have partially fallen or leaning. At which point Frumpkin looks around and this entire area, from the outer very edge where that first perimeter wall was found, to the inside has all been graves, most taken back by the Savalierwood as it slowly crushes whatever this location is at its source. On the far end, towards the core and the back-- the northern side of this final, defending pocket of uncorrupted forest-- you can see a stone building, maybe 20 by 30 feet, built as an old stone steeple. It stands windowless, open, and the floor of it to each open window overgrown with green vine and leaf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin is how far from me at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin is about 100 to 150 feet from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So I can only watch. I have muttered all this, watching. We are talking concentric rings?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think this is the place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nearly every inch of these gravesites contain a smattering scatter of rainbow colors across petal and stamen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am beginning to think this a little more than we came looking for, but we have traveled a ways.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there any sign of life? I mean, other than plant life?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You saw maybe a few frogs, small natural creatures that exist within this space, but nothing that would resemble a human yet. It seems still.

lines.name: SAM, ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's go in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we get over these things? Could we climb them or would we get cut to shreds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can certainly try.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How tall are the gates?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The areas where the fence has been pushed in is between five to six feet in places, areas where it seems to be pushed down lower to about four to even three and a half.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Your friend's coat? I know it's maybe not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You mean the tapestry?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The tapestry. I know it might hurt it, but if we drape it over--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We buried him with it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But that's a good idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You want to go back? I could try to hack at it with my axe.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Could an animal jump over it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You guys could attempt to climb and leap over. Elements of it are thorned and jagged.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is what I used to do to hop fences back in the day. I look for a few broken-down branches that might be my height.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A handful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are going on a witch hunt. We can't go over it, we can't go under it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's fair. It takes you a few minutes and you find a couple of softer pieces of branch and vine that have fallen to the corruption. It's interesting; you touch them and they're supple like vines, but they're gray and freezing to the touch. It's a very weird, unnatural feeling, but it seems supple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before I do anything with it, I take it over to Nila. Nila, have you seen any type of blight on a plant like this before? Do you know what this is? It's cold, feel it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You're right. Do I know what this is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I love making nature checks. Yes! 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've studied and seen, within the vicinity of where you grew up and where your clan had raised you and your children, numerous types of disease and natural means of plant life succumbing to illness or an outside force. What you can tell is that this is not natural. This is not some naturally formed blight. There is some much older and much more powerful latent reasoning for this corruption.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not feel safe using it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know this is well-worn dwarf goof territory, but does someone want to throw me?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That seems very derogatory. Also you're super heavy, though, aren't you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true. You all want to throw me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take the branches and I try to lay them down over the vines a little bit and give a little less thorny of a ramp.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You lean them up against it and slowly they bow over.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, they hook all on their own, that's pretty good.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Good job, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, look at that!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could try to throw you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I guess it might make more sense to throw you, but I don't want to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you can throw me, sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb starts to climb over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you carefully place your hands across the elements of vine and root, you manage to keep a keen glance for any sort of bladed, thorned, or hooked elements that protrude from the local fauna. You manage to avoid any of them from catching your coat, catching your flesh, and step, leaping over to the opposite side without issue.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's amazing! He's amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nobody was aware I was panicked the whole time. The thorns are almost like small razors.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm coming!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Careful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just going to dash over.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're just going to dash over? Make an acrobatics check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was 12 plus... 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott leaps, double flip in the air, lands on the opposite side, skids a bit as your feet hit a slight bit of the icy floor, but you manage to catch yourself, no issue.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg holds up a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You now stand, temperature much warmer, and there's just that stone structure ahead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far away is the structure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you're standing on the interior of it, about 40 or so feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: On the tombstones that are around, do I recognize any of the language, or can I tell how old some of these gravesites are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking through, there are a few languages that come through, most of them are elven and they are very old. Some of them appear to be 100, 200, 400-500 years old. Whatever individuals or families or bloodlines have been interred in this space have been placed here for a very long time, until recently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Until recently, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see one that appears to be maybe about ten years old. Very faint elements of wear and tear.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What's the name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The name on that one would be Elvish and it would be Tyriel Casala.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tyriel Castala?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Casala.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Casala.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She knows Elvish, but she doesn't really speak it often, so the pronunciations get a little weird.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Domo arigato.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So should I go knock on that door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a door?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a door, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hold on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How big a place is the door place?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The top seems to be split and warped a little bit over time due to the moisture in the air.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb tries to creep up to a gravestone and hide behind it to get within 30 feet of the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, make a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the roof or the top of the-- sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On the roof or top of the structure, are there any holes or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The walls and the roof all appear to be made from stone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But no windows or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are windows. You can only really see the front and right side of it, the southeast side of it from your perspective-- there is a single window. It is an arched window that looks like it may have been built at one point to hold glass or stained glass, but it is no longer there. You can see the soft, jungle-like flora at the base of it has swooped up and grown over and into the interior of the structure. Best you can tell from this distance, there is no visible light immediately inside, but there is a bit of natural light that is coming in through the open space.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I go over to the window and take a peek in, stealthily?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, roll a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 12. I'll take a big swig of booze and then go over and try.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You begin to dart across the open space, dodging through gravestones and as you're passing one of them, there is a bit of a thorned vine that catches the back of your cloak. It pulls taut before you get yanked on your neck, slip back, and Nott slams on the ground giving a little sound.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg holds up a ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why do you have that with you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm trying a bit. I'm trying a new thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finally! (laughing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is my stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're really just a random shopkeep in the woods?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's dangerous to go alone--

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: --take this!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just going to get my stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Would you like to describe what they see emerge from this small stone temple?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From this small stone temple emerges a tall, not necessarily healthily thin firbolg, who is pale and a grayish color, and has a big shock of weirdly pink mohawk hair--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Huh. I think I've only got three more cups. Hold on. I go back in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shouting) Do you know her? Do you know him?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It's a firbolg! He is a firbolg!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shouting) Do you know him? What's his name?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not! But he's a firbolg! He is one of my people! (gasps) He is a firbolg. This will be good. My smell bag was right again!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to come out, I'm going to have a little kettle set up on a little tripod. I'm putting it down, I'm putting a big rod with a big purple chunk of amethyst on it underneath the kettle. Tapping it a couple times to get the kettle to start heating up. I'm going to wander into the graveyard and find some flowers for tea.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we tag along? Do you need any help?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does he seem like he's going to kill us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank you. 19.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nein-teen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There doesn't seem to be any threat at the moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Clay, and nah, I'm fine. One second.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's Mr. Clay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Textile family generations ago, but they make very good tea now. (sighs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Clay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm. Caduceus Clay. Sit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caduceus Clay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to put out the three cups and wait for the pot to boil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hello.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that Caduceus with a K, or a C? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi. Oh, we have to wait?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pour out the three cups. You have to share, I apologize.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't drink tea. Booze is fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I come over and sit and take one of the teas.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb and I will share one and I hand the other to Nila.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would love to try your tea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please, let me know what you think.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It is delicious.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Only grows here.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would like to hug you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, please. Come.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Nila gives him a big hug!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I haven't had one of these in a long time. That's nice.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I am from the Guiatao Tribe. Do you know us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How can I alleve your pain?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, well, Herr Clay, we come to you with a great tragedy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A few great tragedies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to, or should I?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, the first one is, I think, it's time for Caleb to have another bath. It's been a little bit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's the first one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Being without a shower has been a bit of a tragedy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Do we really have time for a comedy bit like this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We recently lost one of our friends.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would assume.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's why we're here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: People who come here usually have.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We aren't here to bury him. He's already in the ground. We've come to avenge him and we were hoping to find some help in these parts.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Avenge him? What happened?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you know the Iron Shepherds?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I know the Iron Shepherds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You actually have not. You would have no idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm sorry, I really don't get to leave very often, especially these days.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How long have you been alone out here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (contemplative sigh) Been 20 seasons now, 18 seasons? Try not to count, it just gets in the way of more important things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How many seasons has it been since someone has knocked on your door like we have?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Little bit of business, but it's been very slow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you only gauge time in seasons?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's the only time that seems to matter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you work here? Is this your place? Do you own this land?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm so excited!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you the funeral director?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Most people who come here know what this place is, this is going to be delightful. I've never had to explain it to someone before.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a graveyard. It's a boneyard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, boneyard is a bit crass, but yeah, this is a place where we take the dearly departed who have done well and the people who have lived good lives and we put them into earth that has been touched by the Wildmother. In turn, she grants them with beauty and splendor and sometimes tea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like a boneyard sort of a place?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: More like a garden. We have been tending this garden for generations.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're drinking dead people tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aren't we all?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a very fair point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Very true. But you're cultivating dead people for good tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aren't we all?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, okay. Yeah. That's a good point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are very random visitors from out of the blue. We do come to you with tragedy. We do have a friend in the ground. We do have friends who are in dire need of assistance. You help people into the ground, but offhand, do you help them out of the ground?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I mean, sometimes we can help people who are on the edge of death. We certainly understand that most people would rather spend their time alive than not, and that makes sense. I certainly have no interest in shortening my life any time soon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you can't bring someone back who's already expired?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I mean, that's very tricky. Once you're dead, there's a natural order to things. There's a movement that things have to go, but in certain cases, I'm sure.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've all read stories of the extraordinary, but you do not have this in your wheelhouse, you are saying?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I can sometimes help people. You never know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, well, beyond helping our recently passed friend, how do you feel about helping people who are on the edge of life and death in captivity?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Three in the cage is worth one in the dirt.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: There are firbolgs in this group, too, that need help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They've been kidnapped, including a firbolg child.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And they might not have long to live.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're being held by the Iron Shepherds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who are bad guys. We're good guys. Well, we're sort of bad guys, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're working on it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are not bad guys.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're doing all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you a bad guy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a good gardener.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you grow, other than dead tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I grow lilies, I grow bramble, mushrooms, moss.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dead bramble. Dead mushrooms. Dead moss.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you are saying that you are able to help people back from the brink of extinction, on occasion or under the right circumstances, I am going to hazard a guess that you could heal a wound in a snap, yeah?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not with an actual snap, but yeah, I can do that. I don't have to snap, though. I can be really quiet when I do it-- pretty quiet, I actually have to say something, now that I think about it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to take a guess: you don't leave here very much, do you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've left a few times, I suppose. It's been a while. I've been on my own for a while. It makes you get a little rambly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're stationed here? Are you allowed to leave?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a bit of a story. My family have run this temple for generations, and I'm sort of the last one left holding the fort down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No cousins or anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No cousins. A couple sisters, a brother, my parents, but everyone's either wandered off to help try and fix what's been going wrong or has been put into the earth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's been going wrong? What's that? What's going wrong?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't recommend going out alone. It has been overtaking our temple for the last hundred years, and recently has breached the walls again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So your family is trying to fix that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The last one to leave was my sister. She went east.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Now it's just you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Now it's just me. It's not much to hold down at this point.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why do you stay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, because it's a little dangerous for a lone person to leave. I figured I'd sit here with a kettle and wait for someone to come along, and maybe see if I can make my way out of here and figure out what's been happening in this place.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you're double lucky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is great. So you don't have to check in every night, and be here to punch in and punch out? You could leave whenever you want?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could leave whenever I want, sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there a watering system, or can you put it on a timer if you're not going to be here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A drip-line?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a really good idea. I don't... I mean, if you guys in a serious rush, if you could help I'm sure we could figure out--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe we're in a rush; maybe after.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Herr Clay, we are dealing with a time-sensitive situation. You are looking for a segue out of this predicament you're in?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mmm.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I feel like it's only fair to warn you: if you were to come with us, we'd be asking you to go into a situation that's not very safe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you inviting me to come with you?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Yes, very much.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, yeah, sorry-- did we not--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We came here seeking help in a mission that we're about to go on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's excellent. You're lucky I came along, then. This is going to work out really well.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we came to you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, you're lucky that I stayed right here so that you intercepted me, because if I had wandered off ten, 15 feet this may have never happened.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Herr Clay, we should be very honest with you. We are intending to do good by people who deserve it. A young one. Good people. But we are going to do very difficult business tonight or tomorrow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I don't know if I think that anyone deserves anything, but I don't like cages, and I'm really--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You don't have a particular penchant or sympathy towards people who eat babies, do you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems a little specific. I'm mostly interested in trying to take care of the natural order of the world and nature itself.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does murder end up on that checklist?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Violence is extremely natural.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Tight.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, the people we are after have done terrible things. They have upset the balance of nature so much by what they have done. They do not deserve to live. Please come with us. I have an idea. If you can come with us, maybe some of the firbolgs from my tribe can come help you here afterwards-- can help keep the temple afterwards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I don't know about deserve, but I think there's always somewhere there's a plant that needs some compost, and I'm happy to make some more if it'll make people happy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was that you saying you're willing to kill people and put them in the ground to make compost?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You got a lot of aggression. You got a lot of anger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh man, you're seeing me at a relatively calm moment, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Welcome to The Mighty Nein.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's only--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't overthink it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know Pumat Sol, by any chance?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that a time of plant?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, then no. No, I just had to ask.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've actually already packed; I'll go get my things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?! Wait, what would we owe you for this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you require anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do; I may ask for it later.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Money?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll have it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Firbolgs do not need money.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You'll have it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like this one. I'll go get my green beetle armor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: (excited gasp) I have not come across a firbolg with green beetle armor!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. My sister made it; I'm very proud of her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a chitinous-looking metal breastplate that has a somewhat pearlescent turquoise green-blue tint to it that seems to shift in the light.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get a big, knotted, wet-looking stick that is covered in lichen. The armor is also covered in lichen. It's a big growing, living wet thing. It has a big purple amethyst rock at the top of the staff. I get a little shield also made out of beetle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Motherfucking druid.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) Fungal armor!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) Give me a minute. Just going to walk around once, take it in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If the thing he needs from us is our blood or something, shouldn't we know that in advance? We should find out what he wants from us before we just blindly agree to this. What if he wants Keg?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) We'll figure that out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Some sort of, like, concubine thing? I don't know! What if he's creepy or freaky like that!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm kind of into that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm not picky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Your blood-- you got some to spare. You can get more of it. That's how your body works.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: He does not seem freaky to me at all. He seems very nice. Like a normal firbolg.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (warily) Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. I'm ready to leave. This is going to be a little much, but I think I can do it. I'm ready.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey Clay? Did you bury Tyriel Colsala here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Casala?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, him. That's what I said.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What did you think you were drinking?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (accented) Casala?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah. That's very close. It's good. It's always worth trying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Were you around when you buried him?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Casala family, I think we have eight in their generation; I was only here for the last two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So! Let me tell you about the murderers we are dealing with.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While we walk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Power walking?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Making your trek back to the forest. Are you helming this as well?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: May I helm it with Clay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caduceus. Caduceus Clay. You can call me Clay.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Caduceus.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Deuces!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Deuces Clay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is decided.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have been trying not to show you this art for two weeks now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus, are you wanting to help? Or Nila, I think, is asking for your help in fording this forest, as you have a little more experience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So make your survival check with advantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we going? Back to town, or straight to the--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah. Do we want to go and try to get some Taskers on our side? We have a healer now, but we still don't have--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14 and a 14.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I got 14 and 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's up to you guys.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I don't think we need them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You don't think we need any more help?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We might be all right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't even know what he does!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm with Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's a firbolg, yeah, but... Hey, Mr. Clay? I'm going to shoot Beau with my crossbow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That doesn't seem like a very good idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (arrow whizzing away)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, I was just going to test if he could really heal you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The fuck?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You make me figure out how to do this.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Don't worry, I can cure them, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy. That's ten, but it's a crit. Does that do anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you double the dice that you rolled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so that's 12 plus four is 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 16 points of piercing damage, Beau.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to try to catch it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I roll a d10.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d10.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A ten! Plus my monk level, right? Which is five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think so. Is that what it says right there?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So only one hit point?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just the tip.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 1d10 plus eight. Oh, it's my monk level plus my proficiency bonus, so no damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes for right underneath where the clavicle and the neck meet and catches it right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, but with this crossbow, when I roll a natural 20, it shoots another one immediately.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's right!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do I have to roll for that one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to roll to attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a 23 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage on that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What happens is you pull back to fire, and as it gets ready to go ahead and extend it looks like another bolt slips up into it accidentally and it fires two in a row. Beau catches one and is like "Ugh, ow!" and there's a second one that's jammed right into the space between two ribs.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What the hell, Nott!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: First of all, that was cool. And this was cool!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And third of all, that was a killing blow!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Now, do your thing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You could fucking kill me!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is she always like this? This seems kind of extreme.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: This is the most extreme I've ever seen her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do your thing!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm keeping this bolt, this is mine now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rip the other one out. Yeah! I put that, and I'm keeping this one, too!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Keg is aroused.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Come here. All right, and I get in there and I'm going to do Cure Wounds and there's going to be a little bit of lichen that grows on the wound really quickly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't infect me!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's fine. Do I roll for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wound seems to close as you watch this--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Six points of damage-- six points of healing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go up by six. You watch as this bright red-pink colored lichen, mossy material, seems to come out of the wound and close it and then turn gray, break away, and crumble off. Where it is, the wound seems to have closed and healed over, like weeks of healing have gone by.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, this shit's dope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Probably a different way we could have demonstrated that, Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It felt very--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That wasn't for you. Never mind.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: They can be strange, but they are good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, it's been so long since I've been around anybody, I genuinely wouldn't have been able to tell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In making your journey back toward Shadycreek Run, the sun does set part way through your journey. The forest goes dark, nearly pitch black. Now, I believe all of you but Caleb have some sort of darkvision. At this point, the crickets start coming out very loudly, the distant sound of skittering and animal movements through brush and dry leaves catch the outside of your peripheral. You manage to stop every now and then, as Nila puts her hand up, listening and smelling for anything nearby. Are you guys continuing at a fast pace, or are you attempting to be stealthy?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, did we decide what we're doing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we were going to go straight there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're going straight to the Shepherds?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's on the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We didn't really discuss; we got distracted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. Are you guys heading back to Shadycreek, or are you heading straight to the Sour Nest?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it on the way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's on the way. I say we at least stop by and scout it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If it's more or less on the way then yeah, we can at least swing by.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll add an hour or so to go into Shadycreek. Essentially this is Shadycreek Run at the bottom of the forest and you've traveled, from your perspective, far northwest to get to the area where you met Caduceus. You're now heading back down and the Sour Nest is on the northeastern side of the city, just outside of it, so you have to scoot and ricochet off.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So we'd have to go through the town just to get there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you could go straight to it through the forest, but it depends on what you want to do. If you're going straight there or if you're wanting to skim through Shadycreek, it's your choice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long after dusk has it been?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sun set. With that roll you made, you'll be arriving at Shadycreek Run at about 10:00pm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are going to find somebody, spur of the moment, tell them to come with us out to the woods? To do a bit of dark business?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are you being facetious? I can't tell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I don't know if that's a good idea, I don't like our options at the moment, any of them really. I feel like we don't have-- we are one more person than when we got our asses handed to us on the road, and we thought we had the upper hand then. Now we have one more, that is better, but if we go to the town and we find a couple of ne'er-do-wells who'll work for coin, we are convincing them to come with us right away, into the woods. Into the woods.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Into the woods and out of the woods?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be the hope, I imagine, you'd leave the woods once you went into the woods. I mean, you don't just want to sit there. I mean, that's what I do, but I'm not sure that was really a great decision, so, yeah, huh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you talking to us?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just thinking out loud. I've had a few years to just think out loud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How old are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many seasons old are you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Been about 100, give or take.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But there's four seasons? Or is it three seasons up here? I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's between 25 and 100.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still afraid if we roll into Shadycreek-- once again, just pointing out what we are: two firbolgs, a goblin, and then some kind of acceptable-looking people and someone with a reputation. Well, by society's standards.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A lot of shade just got thrown.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Look, come on!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we do that, the three of us would do the talking, naturally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just saying, we will draw attention to ourselves, and then we might go around asking people to kill the Iron Shepherds, and that might draw more attention to ourselves in a town that it feels the Iron Shepherds kind of run. Or at least have a better foothold in it than we do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How would this be different? That's my question. One more person, sure. A healer? Sure. But--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we could take them at night, which we did not do before. Some of them would be awake, probably not all of them. We had the element of surprise before, we hopefully have it now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They're on home turf.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Home turf is big.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If we can kill them, great, but if our aim is not to kill them it makes this a much easier mission.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know Ophelia, Clay?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, you just had a face like you recognized.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I had to think a little bit about it, but no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, Nott, I agree with you. The most important thing is getting the people who are in that basement. The most important thing. You've always got to improvise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So you're saying go in with the plan of killing them and then switch it up if need be?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The only thing that I believe is known is taking care of the people on that wall, anyone outside.
