I will send Frumpkin around to see if there are more than just these two, then we will have decisions to make. We will need to send in Frumpkin again or our new friend here. One of us, one of them and make a plan from there. That is all we know now. We need to do something and I feel a little on edge with our numbers, but I am maybe more on edge by the ticking clock.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's swing by the baddies' house and just see what's going on?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyone in particular feel super strongly about going and getting more help? Should we put it to a vote?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Do you carry a smell bag?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So much disappointment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She sniffs a purse every time she wants to make a decision.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's worked out so far.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It's filled with things from nature that I find significant.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That seems like a really good idea actually. I should start doing that.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It helps me so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What a good way to make a decision.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What does your smell bag say? Do we go and we get more people or do we go to the house?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I do not need to check it. No smell check necessary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make a smell check.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I just want to go. It will be okay. We have two firbolgs.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, she's so convincing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nila, I love your enthusiasm, but again, they're on home turf, they have more people than I thought, more abilities than I thought. I mean, we hire a couple of Taskers. I know it's not ideal, but if--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, new plan. We split the party!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! Terrible idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Half go to the house, the other half go look for more help and then we meet you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's the half at the house going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Watch.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's swing by the house and check it out. If there's a raging party, we'll just continue on to town. If it seems dead, maybe we'll do a little recon. If the recon goes well, maybe we'll do a little insertion.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are you describing a date right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The insertion goes well, maybe we go steady.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know what any of that means.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You will get used to it. I just laugh along now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Look, they're your people, so I'll leave it to you guys, but I don't love the odds.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I know because of your abilities, if we can draw more of them outside, we will stand a better chance. We will have more power than you had last time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go to the house.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just going to watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to see what it's like at night so if we have to come back tomorrow night, we'll know what to expect. Are there more guards at night? We don't know, they could have six more dudes who come up there at night.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go. We're wasting time just talking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll just look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll go look.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Carefully making your way on the outskirts of the northern side of North Clover of Shadycreek Run, I need you all to make stealth checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage for you, Keg, unfortunately.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tonight, can I just politely ask the forest to just give us a round this time, just in case? I want to talk to a couple of trees, see if they'd be all right just giving us a little passage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll a wisdom check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Wisdom save or wisdom check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wisdom check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You bend in quietly, placing your hand against one of the nearby trees, the bark being cold and somewhat soft from the moisture of the snow that had melted from the day before. You feel the oppressive sense of the central nature that encompasses the Savalierwood give way ever so faintly.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait. Maybe a stupid idea. You guys can talk to plants. Plants are neutral. What if we lead them into the woods?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Now you're thinking like I was. I didn't have that specific idea--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The Iron Shepherds. We could lure them into the woods.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We fight them in there.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: We can have the plants entangle them.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know, it could be a backup if this plan goes south, if they wake up or something. But if they can talk to the plants-- the woods are anyone's game. They'd be fighting other creatures, not just us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But what is it that lures the Shepherds out of their hole?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They won't leave.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got fireworks.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can put a stink bomb inside. Really stinky, not like what you call my stink pouch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That will put them in the courtyard, it will not probably put them in the woods.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'd need to take one of theirs, take Lorenzo or something. They'd have to come after us. There would be no reason for them to leave.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do I know if Lorenzo is a loyal person, like would he give or would he just let someone die if they got taken?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Best that you can tell, he's not a "leave no man behind" type individual.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He isn't?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is not.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But he is a vengeful type of individual?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's definitely a fan of an eye for an eye.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If it goes south, and we manage to kill one of them, he might chase us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: True.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or maybe not.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Or maybe not. It could be a backup.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's good.

lines.name: LIAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, stealth checks, right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth checks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First stealth check. Where's my stealth? Seven.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: These are such bad stealth checks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thanks to you speaking with nature, I am ignoring one of the lowest stealth rolls.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Only one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you begin to approach, Keg, unfortunately, manages to step on a hornet's nest. It crunches under your foot, and, for a brief second, you inhale very sharply knowing this familiar sound-- This is not the first hornet's nest you've stepped into. Thankfully, a moment passes, no hornets. It was abandoned and had fallen from a tree. However, you do hear a voice on the wall say, "Hello?"

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 70 feet from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we might be doing this now, so be prepared for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't want to put Frumpkin in danger, but could we pretend it was Frumpkin, if he shoots out or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin shoots up into the air and bounces off a tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (hoots) "Oh, there you are again, you sucker." He's going to raise a crossbow again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh no! Oh my god, if I kill someone again! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 13 to hit. What is Frumpkin's armor class as an owl?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have an owl here, it is-- That hits.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Burch-icide!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is four points of piercing damage to Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin is alive!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How many hit points does the owl have?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's 1d4 plus one, and I rolled it last time, and I rolled a four, so it's 1d4 plus one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it's five? This owl takes a crossbow bolt to the chest, and is like (flapping). You hear the same voice go, "Fucking hell! What-- Phil! I fucking shot an owl, it's still flying! I hate "this forest! It's bullshit!" You hear this voice a little further away go, "(laughing) You suck!" He's like, "Shut up!" Loads another bolt into it and starts-- You see now is actively looking for the owl to finish it off and regain his pride.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you bring him back? I kind of want that arrow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, I can, but I poof into Frumpkin's senses. Do I hear anything besides Phil and Mystery Man?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check with advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja, because of the hearing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, that's good on the first roll. The first roll is good, so it is 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From the direction of The Sour Nest, Frumpkin glances up and can see, on the second floor, there are two openings you had seen previously on the second floor of this fortress, on each side, and there appears to be a very faint bit of firelight, and a shadow that passes by one, the other, so there is somebody moving on the second floor of this--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who's in the building?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Of the inside of it, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I snap my fingers, and Frumpkin vanishes, leaving the bolt where he was, and then I do it again. He's here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Very wounded, but alive.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: May I borrow one of your goodberries?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this one? Okay.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You may take-- I believe there are four or five left.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will take four.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One, two, three, four. You may keep that one. Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin happily eats from the goodberries.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And he's better?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the wounds close slowly, the magic of the goodberries healing the crossbow bolt over eventually.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, god. Sorry, guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can maybe use this. We could make a distraction owl that he will focus on, and we could take him out from afar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have an illusion that you can do that? It's a good idea. Maybe we should've done that to begin with.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could potentially keep moving now, if we want to, because--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We got the lay of the land?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, we know there's two on the wall, maybe that's their M.O., every night there's two on the walls. People are awake inside. What is the hour right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say at this point it's close to 10:30.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's very specific.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Are you just going for that, or is that going to mean something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry, 10:34 now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: In a minute, it's going to be 10:35.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, approximately.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How about now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still 10:34.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But it's closer to 10:35?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not going to do this right now. We have a decision to make. Doesn't seem any better or worse from the outside, but we are outside the onion. Are we going back to town to get a little more muscle, or are we making a go of it here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Who votes for more muscle? Let's put it to a vote.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, how successfully could we silently kill these two on the wall? You would be good at one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Silently, we can kill these two, I think, very easily. As long as you don't move.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I won't. I'm staying right here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But pitch it to me. How? You, I know--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can take this guy easily, if-- Do you fight people from afar?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not quietly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How about you, Nila? Do you have anything that can shoot from afar?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Lightning, I told you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, something that's not like, "Hey, look, we're here, we've got lightning!" Something--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Poison Spray.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I mean, that's--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Ten feet. No, that's not from very far.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have Beau. She's quiet. I could distract one while you go up and just (crack).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How tall is the wall? How would I be able to get on the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The wall is about 12 to 15 feet. It's not terribly tall. It's about five feet wide.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we walking the perimeter? If we're doing a perimeter walk, I want to look and see if there are any branches and trees that might be growing close to the wall, that I could--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know, from previously looking over it, that they've cleared out the forest about ten feet from the outer wall specifically to prevent anyone from climbing over into the space.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can shoot one with a crossbow.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have a sling, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but we have to finish the job instantly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we've got to do both at the same time, ideally. There's got to be a team one and a team two on the guy. I've got my throwing darts, but they're not super great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Your lightning, it doesn't make a storm around it, right? It's just a lightning bolt. We couldn't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Controlled lightning?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Make it seem like it's a storm, rather than an attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, listen, you can distract him with the actual Frumpkin while I shoot. It doesn't have to be an illusory Frumpkin. I can still shoot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could also shoot him from the dark when he's not expecting it to happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, sometimes maybe it's just a stormy night here in the forest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This Phil must be a really bad person if you're--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, he's a real dick.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Phil's the worst.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are they within eyesight of each other? I'm assuming so.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can, if you guys-- I can shoot. I got a shoot-y thing. I can shoot them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That will be the signal. We attack both of the guys at the same time, two different sides.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's loud. We could just do Message. We can send each other a message that's silent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But if it's loud, and they're both dead afterwards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, the people inside will hear it. No, we need silence.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I could create-- Oh, were you going to say something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know I'm new here, and you've obviously all got some kind of hierarchy going here of how you work this out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb's in charge.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That makes sense. I suppose my question would be: what are you really here for? Because normally, if I'm looking at a complicated problem, I just think about what it is that I really want, and then I go and I do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We want to murder everyone inside and rescue the people who are trapped.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We want to rescue the people who are trapped.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, I was going to say that if you had to put one above the other. If you get one thing, you get to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Rescue the people in the basement.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So you've got to get in and out of the basement. That seems to be the conversation then, is getting in and out of the basement. I'm sure, inevitably, you're going to kill a whole bunch of people in the process of that, but as long as you're focused on where you're going and what you're doing, that may help with this wanton violence against Phil, who I'm sure is a terrible person. He shot an owl.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Phil's friend did.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He thought it was funny, though, so he's still a dick.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that ain't funny.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, let's split up, take these guys out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, it's too early. We need to wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jesus!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's 10:35 at night. We need to wait until they're asleep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Call it 10:37 at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We wait an hour and get into position.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys wait an hour to get into position.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We watch the passing shadows in front of the windows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But sometimes one of them will be faster than the other, and they'll yell to the other, and they'll go see each other from the opposite sides.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How far is Beauregard from me right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How far is Beauregard from you right now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you wander away from me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm right next to you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) Would you rather wait until they are sleeping in their beds before we did this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I was just trying to move things along.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't want this one moving along right now. She makes a lot of noise.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we'll wait. We'll just wait an hour.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's a good question. I'm probably going to ruin any stealthiness.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do know, from the time that you've spent here, that there is no point in which the place is unguarded from the wall.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There's no point at which there is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Meaning there are shifts. The perimeter sentinels that you see currently, there are usually two sets that switch off.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there a time when they change?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is, but you're not entirely certain when it was. You weren't really paying attention.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could take off your armor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was thinking, at least to get into place, and then put it back on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a lot of armor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we are doing this, I feel we should wait until it is late at night, and wait until we see those guards changed, and then wait a little bit further for the old guards to go to sleep. Yeah? So there's a lot of sitting here and not moving. I know we are all very anxious, but we wait, someone comes out, relieves these two, they go to bed, and then we strike all at once. Then we do your plan; it's just delayed, that's all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Until the next shift change. I could use a short rest anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Get on different sides of the facility?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but Keg, you stay here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And do what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With two other people. We're splitting up so we can take them both out at the same time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, you are just waiting until some of us are able to silently take out these people on the wall. Then we buy ourselves a little time while you can clink and clunk as we get closer.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's good that you find levity in the situation. Then we go into the inside of this wall and take the next step.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So it's not three and three, it's three and two.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it's two groups, and you move less right now.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Fair.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I take a short rest?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can take a short rest.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we watch.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we solidify our plan?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mercifully, depending on your intent, the clouds break for a while and you have a clear, starry, moonlit sky overhead that manages to create a rim-light on both the wall, the structure, and the two guards. And you wait. And you wait. And we're going to take a break.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thank goodness. I have to pee so bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll come back here in a second. At this point, might as well put the fortress out there, so that'll be waiting for you when you come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go back to town.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: You're a firbolg!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and Canada, excluding Quebec, throw that into the chat and we'll come back with a winner as soon as we return. See you in a few minutes!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Banana hammock

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Congratulations, Elmosdaddy! We'll get your information and get that out to you ASAP.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Elmo voice) Elmosdaddy!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sounds just the same. Is it the same voice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Elmo voice) (giggling)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To give you a little bit of a visual representation of the size of the base of the fortress.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Elmo voice) Everybody's going to die!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's what you see within the interior of the courtyard. The wall itself resides probably about out here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is inside the wall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is inside the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh jeez.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Above that, still--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: There's a second floor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a second floor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it would be ridiculous to have built that also.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How are you lifting that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's got a little board under there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The second floor sits right about there. To give a little bit of perspective on that. The black dots on the outside, by the way, are where the windows are visible on the stone. You guys are currently divided on opposite ends of the outer wall watching the two guards slowly move their way around the perimeter.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have they done a guard shift yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the interim while we're waiting for that to happen, I'm going to do two things. One, I'm going to cast Mage Armor on myself, and I'm also going to pull a book out of one of the holsters and spend ten minutes changing Frumpkin into a spider!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: There aren't any windows on the bottom floor at all?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. No windows in the bottom floor. There is a front double door, and there is a single door in the back that you know leads into a kitchen.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go Charlotte, go! You're radiant!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He has three hit points, so I think he's actually a bigger spider than the one you're imagining. See, he's right there. He's very big.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How big is that spider?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a pretty big spider.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's three hit points worth of spider.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That looks like a three hit point spider.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody could step on it and he could still go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's a four or five hitter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get Brian Foster in here with his ping pong racket.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's arguably terrifying, I'll give it to you. I was a little wrong, just a little.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put it on Beau's shoulder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm not terrified of it, I'm just saying it could be terrifying. Hi, Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Shortly after midnight, you watch as two figures ascend from the inside of the wall climbing up different ladders that mark the entrance and exit. They both interface in a brief conversation, hushed voices, and then relieve the two previous guards, who then descend down on the inside of the courtyard via those same ladders and disappear into The Sour Nest fortress. So there has been a guard changeover now. It's past midnight, pushing one in the morning. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How are we split up, group-wise? Probably me and Caleb split. And then--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: One firbolg each.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll take the new one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll take the old one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh hey, look!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Table and Table.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: While we're waiting I've asked the Deuce--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm already regretting the name.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you married?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you go to college?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How old are you really?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't really know how to answer that question.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you have kids?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why are you badgering him with questions?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, he's a new friend and I talk when I'm nervous.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why don't you let him think and answer questions one at a time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nila, I guess.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nila is really good at this; she's great.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What am I good at?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Choice words. I think they're talking about you, though.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull the haversack off and say: I have a decent idea, anyway. I think that you should use this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Much like how you spend a moment with your smell bag, you watch as Beauregard seems to focus into this strange, vibrant pink satchel or shoulder bag that Caleb has been carrying.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What is inside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About a minute passes before Beauregard pulls back away, this strange trance passing over her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Death is weird, am I right?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: What did you do to her?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back to my idea, okay. Nott on the other side can probably put a bolt in that guy's throat over there. You can probably vault up the side of that wall, if I'm not mistaken, don't you think?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How tall are you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you be willing to give me a boost up that wall?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you told me about your ability to make things quiet around you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Damn, should've gone with Nila.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You married? What kids do you have?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I was married once. It lasted, like, an hour.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I bet it was a really good hour.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, she sobered up and she said that she made a mistake.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When I hold him, you yank him off of the wall, and then Humpty Dumpty, you know, they can't put him back-- You know how it goes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Copy.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wait, I'm sorry, I need that one more time, but I'll get it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are going to help Beauregard here up onto the wall, quietly, after you use your--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Whatever you call it. Then she gets up there and I am going to use my tricks to hold him and let her rip him off the wall and split his skull upon the stones beneath.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Excellent.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, the thing I was looking at, our version of the smell bag. It's like this artifact that we got from an assassin that lets you look into the creation of space and time and the universe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty complicated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out a little wire and whisper into it to Nott and say: I think we have an idea over here, so we should probably get set.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We haven't come up with a plan yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll get ready over here, give us one second.

lines.name: ASHLEY, SAM
lines.text: How tall is our firbolg?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (singing) How tall is my firbolg? Seven feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven to seven and a half feet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could just copy their plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I can just shoot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you can just shoot, never mind.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If I miss, then backup plan is boost-y to you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can you? I'm like 200 plus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not that strong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (clanking)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't shoot anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can do some magic.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have javelins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! You have a javelin.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I forgot I had javelins. Yes, I have javelins.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess that's our Plan B, then.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Didn't do too hot in the last one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there anything that either of you can do to hold, silence, or assist me as I shoot this fellow?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could give you thumbs up as you're doing it.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: If I cast Pass Without a Trace, can it help them, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, you guys are on the opposite sides of this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a Guiding Bolt, but it's very bright and it's made of light.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's not do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have some insects, but they make a lot of noise.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. It's fine. It's on me. It's okay. I'll just get super drunk.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, I have something I can do while that's happening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matthew?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM. where would you say, in relation to this map, the two groups are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two groups would be probably on the outskirts of the wall here and here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So 150 feet apart, probably.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Quite a distance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How far does your Message work?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like, about that far.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we wouldn't be out a Message range of each other.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Message is 120 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 120 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ayy!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: When I get up there and grab him, I'm going to bash his head in and I'm going to throw him down, and if he's still alive, you get him.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: With my shillelagh!

lines.name: MARISHA, SUMALEE
lines.text: (grunting)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll say you can manage to adjust yourselves to get within range.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you get on the wall off of Nila's shoulders and you do the handhold thing? You know what I'm talking about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I was figuring I would be on her shoulders and we would suck up against the wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out a piece of wire and send a little Message.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right underneath him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll see, yeah. Right underneath him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb! Provided this plan works, after we knock down the folks, someone on each party should put on their cloak and resume their guard pattern and keep walking around the wall.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Very sneaky.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is an excellent idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can respond-- oh, you did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. You and I, we're good. We have this little routine. Beauregard can do that on this side. What about on your side? You? You're short.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keg.

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: She's short.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But not as short as Nott.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You could stand on top of me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are these guys humans, these guards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. (yawns) Pardon me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: 20, baby!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them is human, though maybe 5 1/2 feet tall. The other, because of the moonlight that's coming through, you have a better perspective on him, even at this distance, you guess probably half-elven or just a very thin human. A little over 6-foot. So you have a 6-foot one and one that's 5 1/2 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe firbolg could hunch over and stalk around.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: As a firbolg, you have the ability, no, to disguise yourself? Every firbolg does, to shrink a little bit if you want.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She says to Caleb, who tells me, who tells him.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pass it along!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I guess I can do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm very strong, I could maybe hoist you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Yes! See, you've got a plan, now!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We made up a plan, too!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you doing over there, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're going to shoot the man and then drunky, smoky Keg is going to pick up The Deuce and he's going to walk around--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is my nickname Drunky, Smoky Keg?!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're working on a better one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's not even a nickname; it's three times longer than my normal name! How about Keg?! My normal name!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's literally one syllable. I feel like that's not a lot to ask.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nott, I have a question for you. The plan is not foolproof, but on our side over here, Beauregard's going to throw the asshole off the wall. If you shoot your asshole and he does not die but starts screaming, what do you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Other than shoot him again. We have a javelin and that is all we've got.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I have rope, so I could tie the rope around the javelin, (shoonk!), and pull him off the wall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Makeshift harpoon? That's pretty cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, let's do it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is that now a leading plan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm still going to shoot and you're going to be ready with jav.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or you could attack at the same time.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Said Liam.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's just do this. Come on.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I tie the rope around the javelin.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You message me a countdown and I'll say it out loud to you.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm very scared.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going to wait for our guys to pace--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, the sequence of events is that you two need to get onto the wall successfully.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh, with Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got your javelin tied up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's ready, it's roped.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Battle-optimal position.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: They're here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I say three, two, one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go, Pass without a Trace!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three, two, one, go!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No! Are they in place?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: She's on my shoulders.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm on her shoulders, I'm up against this fucking wall! You're doing this, I'm going to try and (grunt)--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then we're shooting at the same time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're shooting at the same time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to hold Hold Person until these two are right under the guard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to wait until right after he passes, and then I want to do some ninja stuff.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you just sipping tea?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First, I need you to make a stealth check because you're having to move right up against the wall. This is a ten-foot clearing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Use the dodeca if you need to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of you guys roll stealth checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mmm.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Doesn't she get a plus ten to the stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is a plus ten to stealth check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Then that gives me a 20 total. Okay, 20.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh shit, how did I get the same thing? Look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cursed you!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You need to stealth too?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Luck, you have luck still.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your total?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does that apply to her, the Pass without a Trace?

lines.name: LIAM, MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But you have a luck left.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I have two luck points left, but I feel like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you have one because you used one last game.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But we short rested, didn't we?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, we rested.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a long rest to come back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got one left.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Farts.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I think I need to hold that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So 15 and 20? You're throwing a javelin and you're firing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Walks past, doesn't seem to have noticed the both of you.

lines.name: SUMALEE, MARISHA
lines.text: Woo!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rolled a six on his perception. Would you both make your attack rolls, please? Because you are unseen, you have advantage on the attack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: On three?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, Caleb, seeing this, would've went drei, zwei, eins. Hold Person.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That is a 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That just hits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hell yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But you said advantage. So that was a three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was with advantage. Roll again just in case you want to crit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A one, no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, not at all. Let's roll your sneak attack damage and double it on top because it's a crit, and then take another shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Take a shot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 24 so far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage for the javelin.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's 29 damage. As you throw the javelin up, you get your shot, the next attack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll damage for that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You watch as-- (multiple impacts)-- and you yank back. Make a strength check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No whammies. Ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (thud) You're dragging the corpse.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Ten!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He insta-dies, and then got pulled off and then slammed onto the ground and is now being pulled through the dirt and grass. Done, instantly. For you, it's a wisdom saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A natural 12 plus one, that's 13, it's a fail.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, held!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's held?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: As soon that I see that he's held, I am going to jump up and try and grab him by the pants and bash his head in and then throw him down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do. Go ahead and make a martial arts attack. Technically, you have advantage because he's paralyzed.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Just a straight attack?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. 16? No, sorry, 15?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, it's an auto-crit because he's held. Roll your martial arts damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six damage. You throw him to the ground. He falls and takes an additional five points of bludgeoning damage. After the fall, hits the ground-- off the wall, on the backside of it, he's now face down on the ground, still held.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go: Nila, now!

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I take my shillelagh and just let him have it (grunt).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you continuing your attack with her or are you hanging, staying up on the wall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will finish my attack right as she whacks her staff. I'm going to let go and try and time it to where I land on the staff with her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Go ahead and swing the attack. You have advantage because he's paralyzed and prone.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Okay, this is this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Go ahead and roll that twice and take the higher, adding your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Ten plus four, so 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus your proficiency modifier, which is plus three, so it would be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Should be a--

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Which is 1d8.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: d8 plus four. But d8 times two because it's critical.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Come on, Nila.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right as you're slamming down, go ahead and make your next attack.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm, 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With advantage, these are with advantage because he's paralyzed and prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll damage, crit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's much better. Eight plus four, so 12 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 12 points of damage. Yeah, that'll do it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both of them-- one was enjoying the wind and then darkness forever. The other got a cramp and then got bludgeoned from all sides after being jammed in the dirt and then expired.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: "Was enjoying the wind and then darkness forever." Aw, that's so sad! Was it Phil?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was the end of The Sopranos for them, man. It was just--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Phil's asleep, Phil went to bed. It switched, Phil's still alive. We should only leave Phil alive if we can, just save Phil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hashtag save Phil.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Phil is bad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are both done at the moment, it is silent. There is a very slight sound of both their bodies impacting in the dirt, but you're not sure if that managed to reach as far as anybody within the interior of the stronghold. What do you do now in this moment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mr. Deuce, put on this cloak, if you don't mind, and climb up onto there and patrol around, if you don't mind.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This Deuce thing's weird, I don't--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mr. Clay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do the same thing. I slip into the guard uniform.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you think maybe we're going to want some of these clothes at some point?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can put his cloak on right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm really tall, but all right. I'm also going to take a look at this guy they just killed and commit his face and what he's wearing to memory, just to put it in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool, no worries.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Then I'm going to hoist you up on top? Or can you make it there yourself?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How tall is the--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about 12 feet. You might want to help him; he's not the strongest person. Just make a strength check. It's not too difficult.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A million. 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You (grunt)-- you get on top of the wall, you have the cloak on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to rope down really quick, quietly, keeping an eye out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh, nice.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Would you mind giving me another boost real quick?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Not a problem at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Where do you want to go?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look over at Deuce and give a nod.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You said that out of game and I can't say anything about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I send Frumpkin up into the air to do a circle around the entire perimeter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check with advantage please.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Does this mean that they can see in the windows on the second story now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If they want to they can try.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Achtzehn. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There does not appear to be any person in the courtyard. Those two guards are the only two that were currently set on the outside. You can see the horses that were pulling the carts that are set over on the side at the moment. You can see the carts that have since been repaired and are currently waiting in rest. You can see the front door to the stronghold, and you can see the back door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin saw all of this, yeah? Saw the doors, all of that? I'm going to creep my way to the front door and as I go, I'm going to cast Detect Magic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still on the outside of the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to make your way through the perimeter of the wall, which has its own front gate, which is closed. Do you want to head to that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right, to the outer wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The outer wall and out that way, okay. Cast Detect Magic?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I will wait until I am within 30 feet of the wall and then I do so, I will mutter a few words.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I get a free Disguise Self that doesn't actually count against any of my slots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sexy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to be a guard. I'm going to be the guy we just snuffed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Easy enough to do.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I like this guy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's cool, I haven't done this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you give the Deuce your nod, you watch as his form actually shifts smaller and matches the shape of the previous guard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mr. Clay!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Cool trick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Finishing your Detect Magic, you do not detect anything magical of the outer gate. It is locked.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are we going in together? Should we do back entrance/front entrance?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can unlock the front entrance for you guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take my wire and I say: Nott are you on the ground still? Can you meet me at the front gates quietly?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, give us a minute. I am going to rifle through the dude's pockets and go through the guy we just killed's stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an investigation check, because you're doing this quickly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15? Not too bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to go front entrance/back entrance?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You manage to pilfer about 62 gold pieces.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why is he so rich?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you caught him at the moment outside of the town and he had his money on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But does he have anything else useful, like keys?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No keys on him, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, make sure we get the gold out of our dude's pockets, you're right there on the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, cool. Anything else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He felt safe on that wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Anything else useful? No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crossbow that he had seems to have snapped in the process of his body being yanked from the top of the wall. His armor is standard leather armor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything on the dude's armor that I put on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You didn't stop to check, you're already up on the wall.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I can check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you want to. Make an investigation check.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: 17, what do I add?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Investigation.

lines.name: SUMALEE, MARISHA
lines.text: Minus one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16, okay. You find 22 gold pieces.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Added to my ten, that seems like a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And a pack of crossbow bolts, 16 crossbow bolts.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Totally useful.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Waiting very anxiously for my life partner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! Yes, let's go! Oh, not you. You stay up there. Let's go, but be stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd like you both to roll stealth check with disadvantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, with advantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Disadvantage for her because of her armor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, son of a fuck, come on Ash.

lines.name: SAM, LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't go lower than that, that's got to be the worst.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That was the worst. Still not great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is the worst?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Seven plus--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Seven plus five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, 12, good to know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say: Meet at the front gate.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going stealth as well? Roll a stealth check. please.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh god, why'd I get plate armor?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think you still have Pass Without a Trace on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do, so that's plus ten.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Oh, thank goodness. Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lasts for like ten minutes, I think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lasts for an hour?

lines.name: SUMALEE, MATT
lines.text: Up to an hour.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: Okay, so this is four plus ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Eventually, the four of you meet towards the front gate, seemingly, from what you can tell, no one's noticed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From my vantage point, I'm going to see if there's anybody in the courtyard, or if there's anything-- since I'm up there now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I signal to Deuce. I don't know what else to call you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clay, if you have to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Clay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Caduceus Clay. 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, look at the windows, too.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm looking in the windows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you see nobody else inside the courtyard. You occasionally see the flickering movement. It looks like firelight is the source of light that's coming through the two windows on the two sides of the facility you can see. No movement yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to slowly start pacing around towards the front. I'm also going to look into the windows. Do I see anything from my vantage point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20! Thanks, Gil!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not see any movement yet, but you're pretty locked on. What are the four of you guys doing now that you've met at the front gate?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're at the front gate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, I can get this open, but I would prefer to preserve my reserves, so can you get this door open?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure, I'll pick the lock. 16 plus stuff. It's plus four plus three or something like that? Is that right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's your dexterity modifier plus your proficiency modifier.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, plus seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right; yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23, okay. You take a moment and there are two specific locks that are chained; one on each side that are closed. The one that's nearest to you, easy enough. The one on the opposite side, you have to pull out one of your metallic hooks that slips through a space in the wood and manage to pull it up on the side a little bit. You're essentially reverse-picking it with two hooked picks from the opposite side. It takes you a little longer, until eventually it hangs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I miss being a rogue every day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So far, everything's going great--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Why did you say that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we should assume that everything will continue to go great.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh god, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out the wire and get it between my hands and whisper up to Beauregard: Are we good? Is everything good up there from what you can see? Are we good?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Coast looks clear. I don't know why I did this with my fingers.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, now we have a choice. We could just try to go downstairs and get your friends.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is another door over there. Let's get to that door.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The back door?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're at the front gate.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are over there.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh duh, okay. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're making your way into the courtyard now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so we have to get to that door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This door or this door. Your choice.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's the front?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the front.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you could meet me at the corner, since I'm walking around the-- Oh, I'm on the outer. I'm not in the center area yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys have just passed through the gate on that side, where it's open and allowing you into the courtyard.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Caleb, I trust you. Where do we go, back--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no magic on the front door, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still focusing as you come inside?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's like ten minutes, so I've probably got four or five minutes left.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, no magic that you notice on the front door of the fortress.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that we should cut around the side and go to the back. They will probably be expecting that less.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That leads into the kitchen, too. There shouldn't be anyone in the kitchen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, but wait. Can we get Beau and Mr. Clay down here as well to help?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think we should leave them for the moment to keep appearances up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well then, in that case, can you carry Keg?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah, could you carry me?

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I would love to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, but are you able to-- I don't understand your people's ways, but are you able to help her the way you helped Beauregard earlier?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yes, you could use that spell that you used earlier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That ability you had to make Beauregard--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's within 30 feet of her, so yeah, I think she should be good? But I think you have to cast it on the people within 30 feet of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Recast!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you could drop it and do it again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, for the duration--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who has it now?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's as long as they're within 30 feet, it's like a field and you can say yea or nay. That's my view.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It doesn't say at the moment of casting you have to select; just that for the duration you choose. So, my interpretation, I would allow someone to step into the radius, and you could then choose.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, so we know better. We know you don't have to cast it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll snuggle up to Nila.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I choose Keg.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's tippy-toe around the back door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, everyone who's now making their way around the back, make another stealth check.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Am I at disadvantage now? Still?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still at disadvantage, because you still have your armor.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So two plus ten plus five. 17.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I miss Vax so much.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Plus ten, whatever it is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys begin to head around this direction?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Going past the barrel pile where you had previously made your way in and out via owl the previous day. As you guys scoot past, you hear the front door of the facility (thudding) (creaking). It opens ever so faintly to the inside, and a figure peers out, having apparently heard something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't see that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we already went--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, these two. We asked them if they saw anything right before we went.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't see that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a figure poke the head out and look curiously.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What?" Make a deception check, with advantage given that fact that it's in the darkness and not an unexpected scenario.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Hell yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Guard looks past and closes the door.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh my god. I'm going to have an ulcer after this game!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys all continue to the back of the facility.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Except Keg.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: No, you are with me. We're together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are at the back door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to guess that I have two or three minutes left on Detect Magic, so does the door seem clear of that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The door seems to be clear of magic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who do I see on the front door, by the way, really? What did he look like? I don't know who he was, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Young, but probably looked older than they were--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it! Kill it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Aww, damn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nah, that would have been cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was on my iPad!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I should have run with it. You're at the back door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Luck, luck, luck. Is there any gap between the bottom of the door and the floor that Frumpkin could fit through right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a very faint bit that a spider could fit though, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In you go, buddy. Hold on to my hand, please.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could do a hand chain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're not with us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aww, damn it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Telepathically, I tell Frumpkin to crawl up the other side of the door and go onto the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Frumpkin is now up, and there is a kitchen.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sandwiches!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a kitchen, you can see there is an oven. There looks to be a bunch of dirty dishes that have just piled up and haven't been washed in a while. There is a path that goes to the right and further down this hallway, and there is a door that leads further in.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nila didn't tell us anything about a kitchen from her--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The hallway down the right is the one we want to go to, if I remember correctly.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: With the trapdoor.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With the trapdoor, yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's where I will send Frumpkin along the ceiling. Then when he gets to a door, he can go down the door and under, if there is a gap, and then up the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That's through into this hallway, which currently ends in two more doors. This way and that way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are all these doors so far the same? They are loose?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They are loose. I mean, as far as small gaps in between, very, very tiny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A half-inch for Frumpkin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Would I be able to tell him which way to go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He wouldn't be able to hear you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't hear shit right now. I will send Frumpkin through the next gap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one? There's two different doors. This way or this way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, you can't tell me anything.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Here, have a laser pointer.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Here is a laser pointer, Liam O'Brien.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will do this one here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Frumpkin moves into this chamber, which unveils this chamber. In this chamber, you see a dining area of some kind, and you see there are two of the hired guards in the process of finishing an evening drink.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it Phil and the other guy?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it Phil?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them is Phil. One of them is the other guy. Looks like they're having a nightcap.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are they drunk?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They've been drinking. You have no idea if they're drunk. Frumpkin sees the two of them hushedly chatting to one other and drinking from tankards.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will have Frumpkin back away, under the crack.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a stealth check for Frumpkin because now you are in eyesight of--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He is so little. He is so small.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just one roll? That's okay. Hold on, everybody. 14. Wait, everything's crazy. I need a different browser window.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I rolled a 14 but it's better than that, it's 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's fine. They do not see Fumpkin. They have had just enough to drink where they did not see Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (singing) The Itsy Bitsy Spider.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin is going where?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back under that door, and he will peeky-poo under the door he has not checked yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. That leads into another chamber, a hallway, that continues down and then seems to open into another walkway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, this door. This one here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin goes and opens that one, which leads into another hallway, a very small chamber, and there are a couple of odd pieces of dried goods in the corners, and a wooden trapdoor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To the bottom.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Trapdoor to the bottom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems to be a trapdoor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Any cracks that are a half-inch wide, big enough for a spider?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I remember this. Okay. That's a wall covered by that paper there that you don't need to uncover, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a wall, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Back out of this, I know where I am. I will go along the wall here. Frumpkin will crawl on the wall. Oh, you can't see where I'm pointing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the wall over here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and crawl around the corner and peek around the corner into that colored spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Revealing that. It looks, and you can see this has been storage. Because Frumpkin entered, this is all kitchen storage, and looking down this hall--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is too complicated for me to mutter, so I'm not telling everybody this. This is too complicated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is the gist of what you've seen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wow, that's the whole layout, Frumpy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know how much of this will stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure glad we chose a spider!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take back mocking you for your choice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't hear anything, and you're nowhere near me. What I will do is send Frumpkin down this hallway, because I did not go this way yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turning around this way, you can see the spiral staircase, the very same where you had briefly managed to dodge Lorenzo earlier in the day, heading up to the second floor.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I remember this from her stories, so I will continue Frumpkin up the stairs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Up the stairs? Oh god, why? Why would you do that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Time is passing, because he's not that quick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right as Frumpkin passes that way, this door opens up, and one of the two guards heads this way. A little sloppy, but turns and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll make for the wall at that point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ew." He starts walking up, and goes in to try and step on Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What does Frumpkin need to do, armor class, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, what's Frumpkin's armor class?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zwölf.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage. That's 12. It goes ahead and stomps down. That's a hit point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He scurries away-- No, he scurries up onto the wall, up onto the ceiling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the speed for Frumpkin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What? What's the problem?" "There's a fucking spider in here."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's a bug in this world, and I won't rest until he's dead.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The most realistic thing I've ever--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heads back into the room and comes back with these two metal tankards that are dinged up, and they both start throwing them up to try and smash the spider. With that, the first one misses and (clatters) down the stairs.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matt, I don't know if this will happen in time, but what I tell him to do telepathically, because I should be close enough, 100 feet, is to go in here, through this door that's open, and over the door and down the back, and once he's out of sight, I will poof him out, if that works. They might hit him before it happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, the first two slams, or tossing of tankards, clanging loudly, do not hit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I thought it was going to blow our cover.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a spider!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both turn around and follow like, "Where did it go?", "It's this way!" and they both come back inside the room, trying to follow where Frumpkin went.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But he disappears in the back of the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They both look around like, "Shit. Ugh. I can't sleep now with that thing around here. Keep "looking." That's the last thing that Frumpkin hears before vanishing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's two of them. I pull a wire out and I aim towards my friends on the horses. There's two of them. Six seconds go by. There's two of them on the first floor. What do we do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do we do now? Should we go in?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do we have any sense if their clanging disturbed anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did you see a way to downstairs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're listening right now. You don't hear anything, but you're also on the opposite side of where anybody else would be. So you have no idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is a trapdoor not too far from us here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we go try to get down to it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispers) Ja, okay, that's good. We have to be very quiet.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: There may be murderers inside the trap door.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here's what we do. Frumpkin, I take Frumpkin. Oh, there's Frumpkin. I place Frumpkin on your shoulder.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You have to go in this door and I'm going to talk into your ear. I'm going to hold Keg's shoulder and I am going to talk into your ear and tell you which way to go to get you to the trapdoor. Okay, and you have to be very quiet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: By yourself?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and see if that trapdoor is open. If it is, you will put my spider underneath and we will see what is going on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If the trapdoor is open?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If it's unlocked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, if it's unlocked. Okay, got it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do not go in yourself right away, send in Frumpkin to look. I will be watching the whole time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you drinking to the point of intoxication?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, just one big swig.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got to pick a lock first, or check the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check on the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. The door is indeed locked.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will try to pick it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll for that. Plus six.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's still enough, anyways.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That does not work.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What did you roll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It was a two plus whatever I said before, seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You fear breaking one of your lockpicks; you remove it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can't do it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh! Push open the door with your massive strength.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: The noise.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Halt, I cast--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you get us in?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja. I cast Knock on the door.

lines.name: SUMALEE
lines.text: I was just looking!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this strange blue energy sparkle around the outside of the doorknob and the door opens.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, did you cast a spell? Oh, oh wow. Okay, that was easy. All right, focus up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nott, be careful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You care about me?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: At every turn-- Listen to me. At every turn, when you can go left or right, if Frumpkin, who will be resting on your ear, tickles the inside of the ear, it means go right. If nothing happens, go left.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Inside-- tickle, right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tickle means right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing, left. Liam eats farts. I'm ready.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: LIAM, SAM
lines.text: Tickle means right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do another check to see if I see any movement upstairs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're still keeping tabs on it. I'm not going to have you roll just for consistently staring.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just want to make sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you do see a shadow pass by the door-- by the window.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: By the window.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I cast Mage Hand just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What do you do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will go through and wait for a tickle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My hand is on Keg's shoulder in case things go to shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To the right is a hallway, an open entrance that goes into a pantry or storage room. To the left is a door that leads beyond the kitchen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tickle means right; left is nothing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there a tickle?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will go straight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're at a door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will try the door.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It opens, it's not locked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tickle, tickle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel a tickle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I turn right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a stealth check, please, because you're now passing within ear shot of--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a one!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: MATT
